paper_metadata.title: A guide to the total and available phosphate, potash, magnesium and sulphur contents.
paper_metadata.primary_focus: Nutrient content of organic materials for agricultural planning

research_methodology.experimental_design: Not applicable; this document is a guide compiling existing data and recommendations, not an experimental study.

temporal_scope.data_collection_frequency: Not applicable; guide publication date is May 2017.

spatial_scope.geographic_coverage: UK (implied by Potash Development Association's focus)
spatial_scope.regional_representativeness: Provides general guidance for UK agriculture, acknowledging regional variations in rainfall and soil type for sulphur leaching.

measurement_protocols: Sampling according to AHDB Nutrient Management Guide (RB209), Section 2 Organic Manures protocol
quality_control: Adjust nutrient contents if % DM is higher or lower

statistical_approach.significance_testing: Not applicable; provides typical values, not statistical analysis of new data.
statistical_approach.uncertainty_quantification: Acknowledges wide variation in nutrient content and factors affecting it (storage, DM, leaching).

precipitation_patterns.description: Overwinter rainfall affects sulphur leaching, likely higher on light textured soils in high rainfall areas.

soil_properties.texture: Light textured soils (mentioned in context of sulphur leaching)

land_use_context.current_land_use: Agricultural (implied by use of organic materials as fertilizers)

seasonal_variations.seasonal_pattern: Loss via overwinter leaching from autumn applications.

inter_annual_variability.description: Nutrient content of organic manures varies widely year to year.

spatial_variability.description: Nutrient content of organic manures varies widely on farms; sulphur leaching depends on soil type and rainfall areas.

measurement_uncertainty.description: Acknowledged variability necessitates laboratory analysis and representative sampling.

methodological_strengths: Provides default nutrient contents for planning when lab analysis is unavailable.
Emphasizes the importance of laboratory analysis and representative sampling.
Based on established guidance (RB209) and recent research (for sulphur).
methodological_limitations: Default values are less accurate than farm-specific lab analysis due to wide variability.
Nutrient content is highly variable depending on material type, storage, and dry matter.
Sulphur availability is subject to leaching losses depending on environmental conditions.
data_quality_assessment.data_completeness: The provided text is a guide, not a full research paper with detailed experimental data. The provided table data is incomplete (only headers).

measurement_precision.description: Not specified for the 'typical values'; precision is emphasized for farm-specific lab analysis.

representativeness.spatial_representativeness: Typical values are generalized; actual farm values vary widely.
representativeness.temporal_representativeness: Nutrient content varies year to year; potash values affected by storage duration.
representativeness.system_representativeness: Covers 'some animal and other organic materials'.

uncertainty_sources: Variability in organic manure nutrient content
validation_evidence: Refers to AHDB Nutrient Manual (RB209) as a source of validated information.

key_methodological_references: AHDB Nutrient Management Guide (RB209), Section 2 Organic Manures
literature_integration.theoretical_framework: Nutrient management and availability from organic amendments.
benchmarking_data: Typical values provided serve as benchmarks in absence of specific analysis.
validation_studies: Recent research has quantified sulphur supply from livestock manures and biosolids applications.

extraction_metadata.data_richness_assessment: The paper is a concise guide providing typical values and general recommendations, rather than detailed experimental data. Information on methodology, quantitative findings, and specific environmental context is limited by the nature of the document.
potential_ambiguities: The term 'paper' is used, but the document is a 'guide' or 'manual', which limits the applicability of some extraction fields (e.g., experimental design, detailed quantitative results).
The provided 'table_data' only contains headers, not the actual numerical content of the tables mentioned in the text.
extraction_limitations: Inability to extract specific numerical values for nutrient contents due to incomplete table data provided.
Lack of detailed experimental methodology, statistical analysis, and specific site data typical of a research paper.
recommended_validation_checks: Verify the full content of the AHDB Nutrient Manual (RB209) 2017 for complete data tables.
Cross-reference with other PDA publications for more detailed context.
